headline: The Baptism Made Marble
description: A quiet icon of renewal: a modern figure rendered in marble, wet garment clinging after immersion, a small cross at the sternum, and an ordinary, unmistakable smile. The piece holds the moment when water, flesh, and joy meet—sacrament translated into stone, softness found inside weight.
resonantThread: Icons of grace—ordinary bodies meeting sacrament; light made tangible

motifMap.meaning: trace of water; softness inside stone
sign of belonging; the brand of baptism
sacrament in the present, not only the past
weight and permanence holding a fleeting moment

associatedMedia.description: Photograph of a marble sculpture: a newly baptized figure in a wet shirt with a cross necklace, smiling gently against a neutral backdrop.
